section.title: Introduction
section.p: Welcome to the Orbeon Presentation Server User Guide!

Presentation Server is a native XML Web application platform that is purpose-built to automate document-centric business processes with web applications built directly from XML business documents. Although Presentation Server was designed primarily to develop Web applications, it can be used to build all sorts of XML applications, including Enterprise Application Integration (EAI), Content Management Systems (CMS), and more. Presentation Server is part of the Open Integration Suite.

section.title: Purpose of the User Guide
section.p: The purpose of this guide is to get users acquainted with the fundamental concepts of Presentation Server: XML processors and XML pipelines, the XML Pipeline Definition Language (XPL), XForms, the Page Flow Controller (PFC), and Presentation Server's built-in XML processors. It is highly recommended to quickly get to the Tutorial to get started with developing applications with Presentation Server.

section.title: Prerequisites
section.p: This guide should be accessible to anyone with some experience developing simple Web applications. It is helpful to understand the basics of XML and Extensible Stylesheet Language Transformations (XSLT) before reading this documentation.
